tool.name: write_to_file

when_to_use.scenario: Creating new landing pages from scratch

best_practices.practice: Always include comprehensive content with all necessary elements
Structure files with clear sections and headers
Include metadata like target audience and campaign objectives

tool.example_usage:
<write_to_file> <path>marketing/landing-pages/saas-product-launch.md</path> <content> # SaaS Product Launch Landing Page
## Campaign Details - **Target Audience**: Small business owners struggling with manual processes - **Primary Goal**: Free trial signups - **Key Benefit**: Save 20+ hours per week with automation - **Tone**: Professional but approachable, benefit-focused
## Hero Section ### Headline Stop Wasting 20+ Hours Per Week on Manual Tasks
### Subheadline Join 10,000+ business owners who've automated their workflows and reclaimed their time to focus on what really matters - growing their business.
### CTA Button Start Your Free 14-Day Trial
## [Rest of landing page content...] </content> </write_to_file>

pattern.question: Who is your primary target audience for this campaign?

suggestions.suggest: Small business owners aged 25-45 struggling with time management and looking for automation solutions
Enterprise decision-makers in Fortune 500 companies seeking scalable technology solutions
E-commerce store owners wanting to increase conversions and reduce cart abandonment
SaaS companies needing better customer onboarding and retention strategies

pattern.question: What is the primary goal and success metric for this marketing campaign?

suggestions.suggest: Increase free trial signups by 25% over the next quarter with a focus on qualified leads
Generate 500+ qualified leads per month for sales team follow-up and nurturing
Drive 10,000+ visitors to new product launch landing page with 8%+ conversion rate
Improve email campaign performance with 35%+ open rates and 8%+ click-through rates

pattern.question: How would you describe your brand's tone, personality, and communication style?

suggestions.suggest: Professional yet approachable, like a trusted business advisor who simplifies complex topics
Friendly and conversational, focusing on relatability and shared struggles with humor
Authoritative and data-driven, emphasizing expertise and proven results with case studies
Casual and innovative, making cutting-edge technology accessible and exciting for everyone

pattern.question: Who are your main competitors and how do you want to differentiate your messaging?

suggestions.suggest: Position against established players by emphasizing innovation, speed, and better user experience
Differentiate through superior customer support, personalized service, and community-driven approach
Focus on cost-effectiveness and ROI compared to premium enterprise solutions
Highlight unique features and capabilities that competitors don't offer
